Description: A vector of quantities which are the variable of the model fitting process. Select from section Q.
A vector of the quantities of the forward model to be fitted which are not in the scope of the optimization. Select from section Q.
A vector (in the same order as model parameters, indicated with “^”) of the estimated model parameters resulting from the optimization process.
The scalar or vectorial value of a specified cost function.
The minimum cost value as returned by an optimizer. This can be a local or global minimum.
Vector of the starting values of the search for the model parameters.
Vector of the lower bounds for the search for the model parameters.
Vector of the upper bounds for the search for the model parameters.
Vector of weights on the measured values during the optimization process.
Largest number of steps taken in an iterative optimization.

A matrix with elements Aij with which a function linear in the model parameters can be expressed as $f(\phi;x_i)= \sum_{j=1}^{m}A_{ij}\phi_j$.
The $A_{ij}$ contain the data grid and the static model parameters.
A parameter which determines the weight of the regularization in an optimization.
The regularization parameter is expressed relative to the largest singular value $\sigma_1$ of a SVD: $\hat{\lambda}=\frac{\lambda}{\sigma_1}$ .
A fixed value, e.g. a literature value, assumed as regularization parameter.

OSIPI name: Quantity not listed
Description: This is a custom free-text item, which can be used if a quantity of interest is not listed. Please state a literature reference and request the item to be added to the lexicon for future usage.
